page.title: 03A LOCAL FARM (PART 2)
page.content: HE HAS THREE DIFFERENT SOIL TYPES ON HIS FARM,THEY ARE GRAVEL,MEDIUM LOAM, AND CLAY.HE USES COW'S MUCK,POTASH, AND NITROGEN AS FERTILISER.THE MAIN PESTS HE HAS ON THE FARM ARE FLIES AND RABBITS.THE FLIES IRRITATE THE COWS SO THAT THEY USE A LOT OF ENERGY TRYING TO SHAKE THEM OFF,WHICH SHOULD BE USED FOR MAKING MILK.THE RABBITS EAT A LARGE AMOUNT OF GRASS AND ARE INCREASING IN NUMBER.THE FARMER MENTIONED THAT 1985 IS THE FIRST YEAR THAT HE HASN'T SEEN A RABBIT WITH MYXOMATOSIS,WHICH HAS KILLED MANY RABBITS IN THE PAST.THERE ARE A COUPLE OF DISEASES ON THE FARM WHICH ARE MASTITIS AND FOUL OF THE FOOT.ONE OTHER PROBLEM HE HAS ON THE FARM IS THE WEATHER.THE FARMER FINDS THE COLD AND RAINY WEATHER THE WORST PART OF FARMING AND HE FINDS THE HOT AND SUNNY WEATHER THE BEST PART OF FARMING.
